content:
• Friday, December 14, 2012
  • ETH

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: ETH +10%. TVL +7%. AVG +5%. ARQL +5%. EZPW +4%....

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: ETH +10%. TVL +7%. AVG +5%. ARQL +5%. EZPW +4%.
    After-hours top losers: CADX -6%. AVNR -5%. ITG -5%. OTC:BEBE -5%. ISIS -4%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:39 PM | 1 Comment
  • AGNC

    American Capital Agency Corp. (NASDAQ:AGNC) declares $1.25/share quarterly dividend, in line...

    American Capital Agency Corp. (NASDAQ:AGNC) declares $1.25/share quarterly dividend, in line with previous. For shareholders of record Dec. 27. Payable Jan. 28. Ex-div date Dec. 24. Shares +2.3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:20 PM | 11 Comments
  • LDK

    Chinese tech ADRs are closing with solid gains after the Chinese government ended its $1B limit...

    Chinese tech ADRs are closing with solid gains after the Chinese government ended its $1B limit on share ownership by sovereign wealth funds and central banks, fueling a big rally in Shanghai. It wasn't too long ago the group dived on bad regulatory news. LDK +6.8%. STP +6.8%. YGE +5.1%. TSL +5.1%. SOHU +3.4%. RENN +2.9%. DANG +6.2%. CTRP +5.3%. CYOU +3.8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:57 PM | 3 Comments
  • SMG

    At its analyst day, Scotts Miracle-Gro (SMG +1.4%) sees FY 2013 results in-line with estimates,...

    At its analyst day, Scotts Miracle-Gro (SMG +1.4%) sees FY 2013 results in-line with estimates, with EPS at $2.50-2.75 vs. $2.56 analyst consensus and revenues up 1%-3% vs. +3% consensus on flat volume. With more than two thirds of its commodity costs now locked for the year, including ~90% of urea, SMG expects ~$20M in commodity inflation.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:49 PM
  • APEN

    Lpath (LPTN -19.5%) tanks today after announcing a public offering for an undisclosed ammount of...

    Lpath (LPTN -19.5%) tanks today after announcing a public offering for an undisclosed ammount of shares. Terms weren't disclosed, and the offering is subject to customary market conditions with no assurances as to whether or when it may be complete. Summer Street Research Partners is sole book-running manager for the offering.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:29 PM
  • BTU

    Peabody Energy (BTU +0.3%) expects its Q1 2013 results to come in weaker than originally...

    Peabody Energy (BTU +0.3%) expects its Q1 2013 results to come in weaker than originally thought, but sees increased U.S. gas-to-coal switching, and thinks global seaborne coal markets show signs of improving next year. The optimistic take overlooks high inventories, weak export demand and rising regulation; most coal shares are higher: ANR +3.2%, WLT +2.5%, ACI +1.3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:10 PM | 2 Comments
  • CDTI

    Clean Diesel Technologies (OTC:CDTI +5.7%) hits new 52-week highs on news the EPA is expected to...

    Clean Diesel Technologies (OTC:CDTI +5.7%) hits new 52-week highs on news the EPA is expected to announce standards for soot pollution that are 20% tighter than the current rule. The annual standards for particulate matter reportedly will be set at 12 micrograms per cubic meter, down from 15 micrograms now.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:36 PM
  • AKS

    Steel stocks show solid gains following positive China PMI data; the steel sector often is the...

    Steel stocks show solid gains following positive China PMI data; the steel sector often is the most responsive industry to Chinese PMI data. AKS +6.7%, X +6.4%, STLD +5.1%, CMC +3.4%, MT +3.2%, NUE +3%, CMC +2.8%, RS +2.6%, SCHN +2.4%. Iron ore and metallurgical coal stocks also benefit: CLF +4.6%, WLT +3.2%, RIO +3.2%, VALE +3.1%, BHP +1.3%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:15 PM
  • FB

    Facebook (FB -3.5%) is selling off as a lockup on 156M shares expires. Of course, that probably...

    Facebook (FB -3.5%) is selling off as a lockup on 156M shares expires. Of course, that probably has something to do with the fact shares remain up 37% from where they were before an 804M-share lockup expired a month ago.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:09 PM | 1 Comment
  • ARIA

    Ariad Pharmaceuticals (ARIA -9.5%) drops after the FDA approves Iclusig, its chronic myeloid...

    Ariad Pharmaceuticals (ARIA -9.5%) drops after the FDA approves Iclusig, its chronic myeloid leukemia treatment, more than three months ahead of the product’s its scheduled release. However, the drug was approved with a boxed warning alerting patients and health care professionals that the drug can cause blood clots and liver toxicity, which was not anticipated.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:04 PM
  • INFA

    Informatica (INFA +3.9%) adds to its recent rally after RBC starts coverage on the company,...

    Informatica (INFA +3.9%) adds to its recent rally after RBC starts coverage on the company, along with peers Teradata (TDC -0.6%) and Tibco (TIBX -0.2%), at Outperform. The firm notes M&A activity for big data plays is strong, but considers Informatica, Tibco, and Qlik (QLIK +1.7%) too richly priced to attract suitors. "Big Data has emerged as one of the most overused, overhyped and misunderstood terms in technology ... Regardless, it is hard to deny the exponential growth in data and, in turn, the opportunity for technology firms to benefit..."

     
     
     
     
    | 2:03 PM
  • AOBC

    Smith & Wesson (SWHC -1%) and Sturm, Ruger (RGR -1.9%) take a sharp turn down after news of...

    Smith & Wesson (SWHC -1%) and Sturm, Ruger (RGR -1.9%) take a sharp turn down after news of a mass casualty shooting at a Connecticut school breaks out from national media sources.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:25 PM | 12 Comments
  • BV-OLD

    Bazaarvoice (BV-OLD +6.6%) is posting a nice gain after catching an upgrade to Outperform from...

    Bazaarvoice (BV-OLD +6.6%) is posting a nice gain after catching an upgrade to Outperform from Credit Suisse. 13.2% of the online reviews/web site engagement software provider's float was shorted as of Nov. 30, and many of those shorts have made big profits.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:11 PM
  • BBY

    Best Buy (BBY -15.4%) trades below $12 after a deadline gets extended by the board on when...

    Best Buy (BBY -15.4%) trades below $12 after a deadline gets extended by the board on when Richard Schulze needs to put together his buyout bid for the firm by. It appears traders aren't as concerned about the eventuality of an offer - as they are about where they offer might stand after the retailer reports on Q4 sales. On that note, expect some fireworks on January 11 when Best Buy gives its first glimpse at holiday sales numbers.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:52 PM
  • ENDP

    Endo Health Solutions (ENDP -2.1%) slips today after Needham cut the shares to Underperform on...

    Endo Health Solutions (ENDP -2.1%) slips today after Needham cut the shares to Underperform on the back of yesterday's earnings warning. The firm notes that a dead-cat bounce stock may be possible at current levels, but there's little upside remaining due to its "continued deterioration in core franchises, execution missteps and underwhelming operating performance in acquired non-pharma segments."
     
     
     
     
    | 12:17 PM
  • MU

    Micron (MU +2.6%) is trekking higher after receiving an upgrade to Buy from Drexel Hamilton,...

    Micron (MU +2.6%) is trekking higher after receiving an upgrade to Buy from Drexel Hamilton, which cites improving DRAM spot memory prices. Digitimes is out with another column today (previous) reporting of a spot price rebound: it notes DRAMeXchange believes the spot price for 2Gb DDR3 PC chips has risen 14.6% this month, as capacity is shifted to server and (especially) mobile DRAM. Micron's gains come even though many Apple suppliers are off - Micron is about to become an iPhone supplier through the Elpida deal.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:53 AM
  • VNDA

    Vanda Pharmaceuticals (VNDA -1.6%) dips after receiving a thumbs down from the European...

    Vanda Pharmaceuticals (VNDA -1.6%) dips after receiving a thumbs down from the European Medicines Agency's Committee for Medicinal Product for Human Use recommending against the approval of VNDA's schizophrenia treatment, Fanaptum. The agency says, in a nutshell, the benefits didn't outweigh the risks. The drug developer says it intends to appeal and request a re-examination of the decision.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:47 AM
  • YPF

    Shares of Argentina's YPF (YPF +5.7%) surge in early trading, as investors appear to be acting...

    Shares of Argentina's YPF (YPF +5.7%) surge in early trading, as investors appear to be acting on a host of developments including expectations YPF will soon announce new investment deals with Chevron and Bridas Energy. YPF also has successfully issued new bonds recently and company officials are confident they can pull off the new investment plan unveiled earlier this year.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:42 AM
  • S

    It would be "an absolute outrage" for Clearwire (CLWR -0.8%) to be sold at Sprint's (S -0.8%)...

    It would be "an absolute outrage" for Clearwire (CLWR -0.8%) to be sold at Sprint's (S -0.8%) $2.90/share offer price, declares 3.6% activist Clearwire owner Mount Kellett in a letter to the board. To further demonstrate its commitment to fighting for a higher bid, Mount Kellett assigns Clearwire a value of $6.30/share based on some back-of-the-envelope math that values the carrier's spectrum at $18B. Fellow activist investor Crest Financial is also intent on receiving a higher offer. (earlier) (Nov. letter)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:18 AM | 5 Comments
  • WBMD

    WebMD (WBMD +5%) is rallying on an upgrade to Market Perform from Raymond James, which is...

    WebMD (WBMD +5%) is rallying on an upgrade to Market Perform from Raymond James, which is pleased with the health information provider's restructuring plan. WebMD gained 12% on Tuesday after announcing the restructuring, but then fell 6% on Wednesday.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:08 AM
  • DWRE

    Demandware (DWRE -8.3%) is falling hard after disclosing The Finish Line (NASDAQ:FINL) has...

    Demandware (DWRE -8.3%) is falling hard after disclosing The Finish Line (NASDAQ:FINL) has abandoned a site built using the Demand Commerce platform in favor of a legacy site, citing "less than expected satisfaction with customer interactions" on the new site. Nonetheless, Demandware is lifting its Q4 revenue guidance range by $1M to $23.5M-$24.5M, above a $23.1M consensus. Shares have already been pressured by worries about strong European exposure and competition from NetSuite.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:03 AM | 1 Comment
  • USNA

    USANA Health Sciences (USNA -10.4%) trades lower this morning after announcing some dizzying...

    USANA Health Sciences (USNA -10.4%) trades lower this morning after announcing some dizzying changes to its management team. Doug Hekking is stepping down as CFO but will continue with the company in a strategic role, supporting the finance and operations groups. Paul Jones, currently VP of Human Resources, has been named interim CFO. Roy Truett has resigned as COO, to be replaced by Chief Production Officer Jim Brown, who will report directly to the CEO. Finally, to round it all off, Rick Stambaugh has been named chief information officer and Lori Truman has been promoted to VP of U.S. Field Development.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:01 AM
  • YOKU

    Youku Tudou (YOKU +5%) is rallying after Morgan Stanley's Phillip Wan starts coverage with an...

    Youku Tudou (YOKU +5%) is rallying after Morgan Stanley's Phillip Wan starts coverage with an Overweight and $21.10 PT. Youku is "at an inflection point and will turn profitable by the end of 2013," argues Wan, who sees the Chinese online video ad market growing at a 40%-50% annual clip through 2015. He adds the Tudou merger leaves Youku with ~30% of Chinese online video ad sales, and the ability to claim ~80% of local Web video viewers as users.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:48 AM
  • CYTX

    Cytori Therapeutics (CYTX -14.9%) takes a hit this morning after pricing its 7M share offering...

    Cytori Therapeutics (CYTX -14.9%) takes a hit this morning after pricing its 7M share offering at $2.85, a 14% discount to Thursday's close. Net proceeds are expected to be around $18.5M. The company will likely use the proceeds for the ongoing development, manufacture, marketing and sale of its Celution System. CYTX announced the offering late yesterday, at the time saying it would offer an undisclosed number of shares, subject to market conditions.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:40 AM
  • QCOM

    More on UBS/Apple: Milunovich's iPad forecasts for FQ2-FQ4 are falling by 2M/quarter, and his...

    More on UBS/Apple: Milunovich's iPad forecasts for FQ2-FQ4 are falling by 2M/quarter, and his FY13 EPS forecast to $47 from $51.50. If this gloomier assessment pans out, is consumer demand for larger smartphone displays (especially outside the U.S.) partly responsible? And if so, will Apple be driven to finally offer an iPhone with a ~4.5" display? Apple is back to trading at a paltry 7x FY13E EPS, and component suppliers are off again: QCOM -4.6%. CRUS -5.1%. TQNT -3.1%. SWKS -4.7%. AVGO -4.4%. BRCM -3%. OVTI -1.2%. (Wozniak)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:35 AM | 1 Comment
  • AAPL

    More on UBS's Apple (AAPL -2.9%) target cut: Analyst Steve Milunovich hasn't changed his FQ1...

    More on UBS's Apple (AAPL -2.9%) target cut: Analyst Steve Milunovich hasn't changed his FQ1 iPhone forecast much, but has lowered his estimates for each of the next 3 quarters by 5M. He claims Supply chain checks indicate the iPhone build rate will fall to 25M in the March quarter (his sales estimate for the quarter is still at 40M); that some Chinese sources don't expect the iPhone 5 to do as well as the 4S; and (like others) that the iPad Mini is cannibalizing its bigger peer.  On a more positive note, he thinks China Mobile could start selling the iPhone in a year. (Macquarie)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:19 AM | 31 Comments
  • VGZ

    Vista Gold (VGZ -9.5%) resumes trading after a brief halt on the company's announcement of the...

    Vista Gold (VGZ -9.5%) resumes trading after a brief halt on the company's announcement of the pricing of its 3.6M unit offering at $2.75 each. VGZ expects the offering will yield gross proceeds of $10M, which it intends to use in advancing its Mt. Todd gold project in Australia and for other purposes.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:18 AM
  • DS

    There's no tax-related selling in Newcastle Investment (NCT +2.3%), which hangs near a 52-week...

    There's no tax-related selling in Newcastle Investment (NCT +2.3%), which hangs near a 52-week high after being initiated a Buy with $10 price target at UBS. Shares +84.7% YTD, along with a 10.2% yield. They call that a home run in the business.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:12 AM | 4 Comments
  • SCHW

    Schwab (SCHW -1.8%) slips after reporting a 2% M/M decline (flat Y/Y) in daily average trades....

    Schwab (SCHW -1.8%) slips after reporting a 2% M/M decline (flat Y/Y) in daily average trades. "Client trading activity remains muted as we head towards the end of the year." (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:06 AM
  • IONS

    ISIS Pharmaceuticals (ISIS -1.8%) and Genzyme (NASDAQ:SNY) say the Committee for Medicinal...

    ISIS Pharmaceuticals (ISIS -1.8%) and Genzyme (NASDAQ:SNY) say the Committee for Medicinal Products for Human Use adopted a negative opinion for its marketing authorization of the cholesterol drug Kynamro, a setback for the treatment.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:56 AM
  • ANGI

    Angie's List (ANGI +2.7%) opens higher after Needham starts coverage at Buy. The firm argues...

    Angie's List (ANGI +2.7%) opens higher after Needham starts coverage at Buy. The firm argues Angie's will benefit from network effects and "can replicate the success in its mature markets across its other markets," and will improve its profitability thanks to "the high lifetime value per member relative to member acquisition costs." Northland started coverage at Outperform on Angie's, which trades well below its Spring highs, on Nov. 27.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:47 AM | 1 Comment
  • TVIAQ

    Solazyme (SZYM +18.6%) shares pop at the open after the renewable oil and bioproducts company...

    Solazyme (SZYM +18.6%) shares pop at the open after the renewable oil and bioproducts company announced last night the successful completion of multiple initial fermentations. The news could be significant because SZYM has now demonstrated its ability to scale its renewable oil fermentation process to 500K-liter vessels, Kevin Quon writes.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:37 AM
  • PAY

    VeriFone (NYSE:PAY) is giving up on mobile card readers, citing the high cost of acquiring...

    VeriFone (NYSE:PAY) is giving up on mobile card readers, citing the high cost of acquiring customers for a low-margin business. "Our experience ... tells us that the standalone economics of micro-merchant acquiring are fundamentally unprofitable," said CEO Doug Bergerson during VeriFone's FQ4 earnings call - it was only in May his company launched its Sail card reader. Did Square's unmatched scale drive VeriFone out? And if so, does it bode poorly PayPal and Groupon's efforts to compete? PAY -5.8% thanks to its FQ4 miss and light FQ1 guidance.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:33 AM
  • MBI

    Yesterday's hope (which sent MBI shares higher) a settlement was close between Bank of America...

    Yesterday's hope (which sent MBI shares higher) a settlement was close between Bank of America (NYSE:BAC) and MBIA looks dead as BofA completes its purchase of the some of the insurer's debt and promptly issues a default notice. MBI -2.7% early. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:31 AM | 5 Comments
  • ALXA

    Alexza Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ALXA) and Grupo Ferrer Internacional say the Committee for...

    Alexza Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ALXA) and Grupo Ferrer Internacional say the Committee for Medicinal Products for Human Use delivered a positive opinion on recommending European marketing of Adasuve, their treatment for schizophrenia and bipolar disorder. ALXA +19.1% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:27 AM | 1 Comment
  • BBY

    Best Buy (NYSE:BBY) pushes back its deadline for a bid from Richard Schulze's group to a...

    Best Buy (NYSE:BBY) pushes back its deadline for a bid from Richard Schulze's group to a February 1 to February 28 window, according to breaking reports. BBY -8.6% premarket off the news.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:12 AM
  • ALXA

    Premarket gainers: ALXA +18%. ALU +10%. TIVO +5%. ADBE +5%. Losers: CYTX -15.66%. CNC -8%. BBY...

    Premarket gainers: ALXA +18%. ALU +10%. TIVO +5%. ADBE +5%.
    Losers: CYTX -15.66%. CNC -8%. BBY -8%. PAY -7%. ISIS -6%. FBR -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:10 AM
  • FCEL

    FuelCell Energy (NASDAQ:FCEL) +9.9% premarket after announcing the sale of a 14.9 MW fuel cell...

    FuelCell Energy (NASDAQ:FCEL) +9.9% premarket after announcing the sale of a 14.9 MW fuel cell park in Bridgeport, Conn., which includes the manufacture and sale of five of FCEL's 2.8 MW fuel cell power plants. Connecticut Light and Power will buy the clean electricity generated by the facility under a 15-year fixed price energy purchase agreement. Dominion (NYSE:D) owns the facility and will oversee development.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:00 AM | 1 Comment
  • BTU

    Peabody Energy (NYSE:BTU) says Q1 2013 should mark a trough in earnings, with results expected...

    Peabody Energy (NYSE:BTU) says Q1 2013 should mark a trough in earnings, with results expected to increase as the year proceeds based on improving Australian production and margins. For FY 2013, BTU is targeting capex ~50% lower than 2012 targets of $1B-$1.1B, and U.S. sales volumes of 180M-190M tons vs. 2012 targets of 188M-192M tons. BTU -1.8% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:53 AM
  • CLSN

    Premarket weakness in Celsion (NASDAQ:CLSN) is attributed to a TheStreet.com article suggesting...

    Premarket weakness in Celsion (NASDAQ:CLSN) is attributed to a TheStreet.com article suggesting taking profits ahead of Jan. trial results for its ThermoDox drug candidate for treatment of primary liver cancer. Also, CLSN shares have more than doubled since mid-November. CLSN -6.9% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:44 AM | 3 Comments
  • SLB

    Schlumberger (NYSE:SLB) -2.3% premarket after warning of a $0.05-$0.07 cut to expected EPS in...

    Schlumberger (NYSE:SLB) -2.3% premarket after warning of a $0.05-$0.07 cut to expected EPS in Q4, caused by contractual delays combined with higher than usual seasonal slowdowns in activity in the Europe/CIS/Africa area plus weaker than anticipated land activity in North America. HAL -1.3%, BHI -1.6%.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:33 AM
  • CNC

    Centene (NYSE:CNC) -4% premarket after cutting its view for the current year, seeing EPS of...

    Centene (NYSE:CNC) -4% premarket after cutting its view for the current year, seeing EPS of $0.10-$0.20 vs. prior guidance of $0.56-$0.66. The Medicaid insurer blames its lower view on higher medical costs associated with an earlier and more intensive flu season in its largest markets. Sees FY 2013 EPS in-line.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:25 AM
  • AAPL

    Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL) is taking it on the chin again this morning as chatter about weak iPhone 5...

    Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL) is taking it on the chin again this morning as chatter about weak iPhone 5 demand in China, and UBS taking its price target on the stock down to $700 from $780 has the shares off 2.2% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:00 AM | 54 Comments
  • NOK

    Alcatel-Lucent (ALU) gains liquidity and breathing room to effect its turnaround by securing...

    Alcatel-Lucent (ALU) gains liquidity and breathing room to effect its turnaround by securing financing of €1.615B of senior secured credit facilities, which have maturities of 3-6.5 years and are being underwritten by Credit Suisse (NYSE:CS) and Goldman Sachs (NYSE:GS). Alcatel-Lucent expects the facilities to be secured by its vast IP portfolio and for the financing to be completed by January. Shares +13.7% in Paris. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 3:23 AM | 4 Comments

  • Chinese shares surge 4.3% after the flash HSBC PMI rises to a 14-month high of 50.9 in December...

    Chinese shares surge 4.3% after the flash HSBC PMI rises to a 14-month high of 50.9 in December from 50.5 in November, adding to recent other data showing that the economic turnaround is gaining momentum. HSBC says the growth is mainly driven by domestic demand, and cautions that "the drop of new export orders and the downside surprise of November exports growth suggest persisting external headwinds." (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:35 AM | 2 Comments
